references.formattedCitation: Laidlaw, Anne, and Marco Salvatore Stella. The House of Sallust in Pompeii (VI 2, 4). Journal of Roman Archaeology, 2014.

description: The House of Sallust (VI 2,4) is a domus in Pompeii that assumes its final form around the second century B.C.
details: The name ascribed to the domus derives from an electoral graffito that recommends Caius Sallustius for office. Another, alternative name - this one based on another inscription from the ruins - is the House of A. Cossus Libanus.
